segment.source: Using Compatibility Monitor to Send Feedback (Windows 10)
segment.target: Using Compatibility Monitor to Send Feedback (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Microsoft Compatibility Monitor tool is installed as part of the runtime-analysis package.
segment.target: The Microsoft Compatibility Monitor tool is installed as part of the runtime-analysis package.

segment.source: Using Compatibility Monitor to Send Feedback
segment.target: Using Compatibility Monitor to Send Feedback

segment.target: Applies to

segment.target: Windows 10

segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.target: Windows 8

segment.target: Windows 7

segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The Microsoft Compatibility Monitor tool is installed as part of the runtime-analysis package.
segment.target: The Microsoft Compatibility Monitor tool is installed as part of the runtime-analysis package.

segment.source: From the computers in your test environment, you can use Compatibility Monitor to submit compatibility information to the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) database for your organization.
segment.target: From the computers in your test environment, you can use Compatibility Monitor to submit compatibility information to the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) database for your organization.

segment.source: To automatically monitor applications on your computer for compatibility issues
segment.target: To automatically monitor applications on your computer for compatibility issues

segment.source: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.
segment.target: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.

segment.source: In Compatibility Monitor, click Start Monitoring.
segment.target: In Compatibility Monitor, click Start Monitoring.

segment.source: Leave Compatibility Monitor running, and use the applications that you want to test for compatibility issues.
segment.target: Leave Compatibility Monitor running, and use the applications that you want to test for compatibility issues.

segment.source: Compatibility information is automatically detected during monitoring, and is silently submitted to the ACT database at regular intervals.
segment.target: Compatibility information is automatically detected during monitoring, and is silently submitted to the ACT database at regular intervals.

segment.source: After you finish testing applications, click Stop Monitoring to stop the automatic monitoring and submission of compatibility information.
segment.target: After you finish testing applications, click Stop Monitoring to stop the automatic monitoring and submission of compatibility information.

segment.source: To submit your compatibility rating for an application
segment.target: To submit your compatibility rating for an application

segment.source: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.
segment.target: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.

segment.source: In Compatibility Monitor, click Give Compatibility Feedback.
segment.target: In Compatibility Monitor, click Give Compatibility Feedback.

segment.source: You can enter and submit compatibility ratings whether monitoring is on or off.
segment.target: You can enter and submit compatibility ratings whether monitoring is on or off.

segment.source: The process of submitting your compatibility feedback is entirely independent of the monitoring process.
segment.target: The process of submitting your compatibility feedback is entirely independent of the monitoring process.

segment.source: Find your application in the list, and then select your compatibility rating for the application.
segment.target: Find your application in the list, and then select your compatibility rating for the application.

segment.source: You can select ratings for one or more applications.
segment.target: You can select ratings for one or more applications.

segment.source: Click Submit to submit your compatibility ratings to the ACT database.
segment.target: Click Submit to submit your compatibility ratings to the ACT database.

segment.source: A copy of your ratings is kept on your computer so that you can review and modify the ratings later.
segment.target: A copy of your ratings is kept on your computer so that you can review and modify the ratings later.

segment.source: To submit a description of a compatibility issue for an application
segment.target: To submit a description of a compatibility issue for an application

segment.source: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.
segment.target: Start the Compatibility Monitor tool.

segment.source: In Compatibility Monitor, click Give Compatibility Feedback.
segment.target: In Compatibility Monitor, click Give Compatibility Feedback.

segment.source: Find your application in the list, and then click the Add Details link.
segment.target: Find your application in the list, and then click the Add Details link.

segment.source: In the Title box, enter a title for the compatibility issue.
segment.target: In the Title box, enter a title for the compatibility issue.

segment.source: The title is typically a phrase that briefly describes the issue.
segment.target: The title is typically a phrase that briefly describes the issue.

segment.source: Check with others in your organization to verify your organization’s preferred style for issue titles.
segment.target: Check with others in your organization to verify your organization’s preferred style for issue titles.

segment.source: In the Description box, enter a description of the compatibility issue.
segment.target: In the Description box, enter a description of the compatibility issue.

segment.source: Optionally, attach a screen shot or a step-by-step recording of the compatibility issue.
segment.target: Optionally, attach a screen shot or a step-by-step recording of the compatibility issue.

segment.source: Click Submit to submit your compatibility issue to the ACT database.
segment.target: Click Submit to submit your compatibility issue to the ACT database.

segment.source: After submitting your compatibility issue, you cannot edit it later.
segment.target: After submitting your compatibility issue, you cannot edit it later.

segment.source: To submit further compatibility issues, you will need to submit a new issue.
segment.target: To submit further compatibility issues, you will need to submit a new issue.
